results.title: Facts
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
A change in working hours upsets the workers at a factory and Dixon, the Union delegate, is asked to report the change to the union office. In his report to the organiser, Dixon manages to bring in all sorts of irrelevancies but is very short on accurate information. This film manages to pinpoint an area of possible confusion if union delegates fail to get the facts straight.

results.title: Interview
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”
A factory worker complains to his union delegate when he is required to work overtime at short notice. The film pinpoints the need for the delegate to calm down the union member and sort out the facts before he can discuss the incident with management.

results.title: Rocks and minerals. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
Provides clear description of how the various types of igneous, sedimentary and metamorphic rocks are formed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Soil
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
An explanation of soil profile (topsoil, subsoil, mantle rock and bed rock); plus a visual breakdown of the elements of soil (sand, decaying plant and animal matter and clay). Explains how soil is produced, discusses methods of soil conservation and describes types of soils found throughout the United States.

results.title: How its surface changes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
Explains the slow but constant changes in the surface of the earth by showing the erosive effects of water and wind upon a recently excavated mound of raw earth. Includes scenes of the eruption of the Paracutin Volcano, the Grand Canyon of the Colorado River, and a rocky mountainside, pointing out the geologic evidence of forces which continue to build up and wear away the surface of the earth.

results.title: Glaciers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
Shows the formation of many different types glaciers and describes the effect of glacial action as seen in the lakes of the Rockies, soil in the American Corn Belt, glacial drift in new England, and the Matterhorn peak in the Swiss Alps.

results.title: Understanding maternal grief
results.creator_credit: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions
results.brief_description: A five part series introduced by Margaret Nicol, clinical psychologist and author which deals with distinct aspects of maternal grief. The programmes are dedicated to all women who have grieved over the loss of a baby and to the memory of those children. Each episode is designed to look at the experiences of women who have suffered different types of reproductive loss. The focus is on the need for the womens’ experiences to be validated and for the existence of the lost child to be acknowledged.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions

results.title: Loss of a baby: death of a dream
results.creator_credit: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
This program addresses the issue of women’s grief following a reproductive loss. Reproductive loss is seen to encompass miscarriage, stillbirth, neonatal death, the birth of a handicapped baby and infertility. The video incorporates dicussion of the major psychological aspects of maternal grief with Margaret Nicol (Psychologist) and Dr. Howard Chilton (Neonatologist), along with interviews with bereaved women. The four bereaved women describe their journey in grief over many years, presenting those experiences which were helpful and unhelpful in this process.

results.title: The Birth of a handicapped baby
results.creator_credit: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
Why? Why did this happen to me? This video looks at the grief reaction women following the birth of a disabled baby. Effects of long term stress and the impact of unresolved grief are illustrated through an interview with the mother of a teenage child born with severe disabilities.
